org.mundo.rt
Class Service

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.Service
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEmits
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractHandler, ActivationService, Agent, BinCollectHandler, BinFragHandler, BinSerializationHandler, ContentBroker, CORBAInvocationService, DebugService, DefaultApplication, DirectoryMonitor, DropHandler, DVEventRouter, EventRouterClient, FilteredBroker, HLFragHandler, IPTransportService, NAckHandler, P2PTopicBroker, ProcessMonitor, ProtocolCoordinator, RMCService, RMIInvocationService, RootService, RoutingService, TraceHandler, XMLSerializationHandler
public class Service
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEmits

A service is a not-too-small component of an application that performs some functionality by processing messages received from channels or by being invoked via remote method calls (RMC).

Before an application is able to send or receive messages, it must perform the following steps:

  • Create a Session object. Usually an application-specific class implementing a service is derived from Service.
  • Register the service by calling Mundo.registerService. This method will assign a Session to the Service and finally call the init method.
  • In the init-Method, the application-specific service should perform all necessary initialization. It is now able to use the session object to create Publisher and Subscriber objects.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler
See Also:
Mundo

Returns:
the friendly name of this service; or null if no friendly name has been assigned.

getServiceInfoUserData

public java.lang.Object getServiceInfoUserData()
Provide a hook for service developers to add their own serializable object structure into the ServiceInfo object. This enables refined queries with ServiceDiscovery and ServiceInfoFilters.

init

public void init()
Initializes the service. Clients should override this method and create e.g. Publisher and Subscriber objects. init is called by Mundo.registerService after the service's session object has been initialized. This method must be called by means of super.init (at the beginning) of the overriding method.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shuts down the service. All subscriptions and advertisements are removed. If shutdown is overridden, this method must be called by means of super.shutdown (at the end) of the overriding method. In addition, a service's shutdown implementation must free all allocated system resources and terminate all custom threads.

getState

public int getState()
Returns the state of this service.

Returns:
one of STATE_*.

setState

protected void setState(int s)

setServiceConfig

public void setServiceConfig(java.lang.Object cfg)
Sets configuration options for this service. With regard to configuration, three different types of services can be distinguished:
  • No configuration: Services that do not support custom configuration options, throw an UnsupportedOperationException on an attempt to call setConfig.
  • Static configuration: These services support one-time configuration. setConfig must be called before init/registerService. If setConfig is called after initialization, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
  • Dynamic re-configuration: These services permit changing configuration options at any time.

Parameters:
cfg - a service specific object containing the configuration options.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the service does not support setting configuration options. This is the default behaviour of Service.setConfig.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the service does not support re-configuration.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided configuration object is not of the expected class or the configuration data is invalid.

getServiceConfig

public java.lang.Object getServiceConfig()
Returns the configuration options for this service.

Returns:
the configuration options for this service; or null if the operation is not supported.

java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the service does not support re-configuration.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided configuration object is not of the expected class or the configuration data is invalid.
